M-101.topic: Perceive the need for improving communication in English for employability
Use adjectives and articles effectively while speaking and in writing
Write simple sentences
Develop positive self-esteem for harmonious relationships
Use affixation to form new words
Use prepositions and use a few phrasal verbs contextually
Use social media with discretion
Speak about abilities and possibilities
Make requests and express obligations
Use modal verbs and main verbs in appropriate form
Write short dialogues about everyday situations
Realize the importance of humour for a healthy living
Improve vocabulary related to the theme
Inculcate reading and speaking skills
Frame sentences with proper Subject – Verb agreement
Understand the features of a good paragraph and learn how to gather ideas as a preliminary step for writing a good paragraph.
Learn to deal with failures in life
Use the present tense form for various every day communicative functions such as speaking and writing about routines, professions, scientific descriptions and sports commentary
Write paragraphs with coherence and other necessary skills
Understand the ecological challenges that we face today and act to save the environment.
Narrate / Report past events and talk about future actions
Develop vocabulary related to environment
Write e-mails
Appraise and value other cultures for a happy living in multi-cultural workspace
Understand the usage of different types of sentences
Ask for or give directions, information, instructions
Use language to express emotions in various situations
Write letters in various real life situations
Understand the functional difference between Active Voice and Passive Voice
Use Passive Voice to speak and write in various contexts
Understand the major parts and salient features of an essay
Learn about latest innovations and get motivated
Understand the importance of setting goals in life
Report about what others have said both in speaking and writing
Write an essay following the structure in a cohesive and comprehensive manner
Apply the words related to Goal Setting in conversations and in life
Value the other genders and develop a gender-balanced view towards life
Identify the use of different conjunctions in synthesising sentences
Write various types of sentences to compare and contrast the ideas
Apply the knowledge of sentence synthesis in revising and rewriting short essays
Develop discourses in speech and writing
Be aware of different kinds of disasters and the concept of disaster management
Generate vocabulary relevant to disaster management and use it in sentences
Analyze an error in a sentence and correct it
Learn and write different kinds of reports

M-102.topic: Define Set, Ordered pair and Cartesian product of two sets - examples.
Explain Relations and Functions – examples
Find Domain & Range of functions – simple examples.
Define one-one and onto functions.
Find the inverse of a function – simple examples.
Define rational, proper and improper fractions of polynomials.
Explain the procedure of resolving proper fractions of the types mentioned below into partial fractions

Compute sum, difference, scalar multiplication and product of matrices.
Define the transpose of a matrix and state its properties – examples.
Define symmetric and skew-symmetric matrices with examples.
Define determinant of a square matrix; minor, co-factor of an element of a 3x3 square matrix with examples.
Distinguish singular and non-singular matrices. Define multiplicative inverse of a matrix and list properties of adjoint and inverse.
Solve a system of 3 linear equations in 3 unknowns using Cramer’s rule and matrix inversion method.
Define trigonometric ratios of any angle - List the values of trigonometric ratios at specified values.
Draw graphs of trigonometric functions - Explain periodicity of trigonometric functions.

Give simple examples on compound angles to derive the values of sin15°, cos15°, sin75°, cos75°, tan 15°, tan75° etc.
Derive identities like sin(A+B) sin(A-B) = sin² A –sin² B etc.
Solve simple problems on compound angles.
Derive the formulae of multiple angles 2A, 3A etc and sub multiple angle A/2 in terms of angle A of trigonometric functions.
Derive useful allied formulae like sin²A= (1- cos2A)/2 etc.
Solve simple problems using the multiple and submultiple formulae.
Derive the formulae on transforming sum or difference of two trigonometric ratios into a product and vice versa.
Solve problems by applying these formulae to sum or difference or product of two terms.
Explain the concept of the inverse of a trigonometric function.
Define inverses of six trigonometric functions along with their domains and ranges.
Derive relations between inverse trigonometric functions.
State various properties of inverse trigonometric functions and identities.
Apply formulae of inverse trigonometric functions to solve Simple problems.
Explain what is meant by solution of trigonometric equations and find the general solutions.
Solve models of the type a sin² x + b sin x +c=0 and a sin x + b cos x=c.
State sine rule, cosine rule, tangent rule and projection rule and solve a triangle using these formulae.
List various formulae for the area of a triangle with examples.
Define a complex number, its modulus, conjugate, amplitude and list their properties.
Define arithmetic operations on complex numbers with examples.
Represent the complex number in various forms like modulus-amplitude (polar) form, Exponential (Euler) form with examples.
Write different forms of a straight line.
Find distance of a point from a line, acute angle between two lines, intersection of two non-parallel lines and distance between two parallel lines.
Define locus of a point and circle.
Write the general equation of a circle and find its centre and radius.
Find the equation of a circle given specific conditions.

Find the equation of a conic when focus, directrix and eccentricity are given.
Describe the properties of Parabola, Ellipse and Hyperbola in standard forms and solve simple examples.

Evaluate the limits of various types.
State the Standard limits and solve simple problems.
Explain the concept of continuity of a function at a point and on an interval.
State the concept of derivative of a function y = f(x).
Explain the significance of derivative in scientific and engineering applications.
Find the derivative of standard functions using the first principle.
Find the derivatives of inverse trigonometric, hyperbolic and inverse hyperbolic functions.

Explain the method of differentiation of a function of a function (Chain rule).

Explain the procedure for finding the derivatives of implicit functions.
Explain logarithmic differentiation.
Explain the concept of finding the second order derivatives.
Explain the concept of functions of several variables and partial derivatives.

Explain the procedure to find the extreme values (maxima or minima).
Apply the concept of derivatives to find the errors and approximations.

state the Factors influencing the rate of corrosion.

Transistors: PNP and NPN transistors, symbols and working.
Electrical Safety: Electric shock, Precautions, Earthing.

M-303.topic: Define Perfect gas, State the laws of perfect gases (Boyle’s, Charle’s, Joule’s, Regnault’s, Avogadro’s).
Derive Characteristic Gas equation.
Define Specific heats (Cp and Cv) and relation between them (R = Cp - Cv).
Solve simple problems on gas laws and characteristic gas equation.
State First Law of Thermodynamics.
Define thermodynamic system, surroundings, boundary, state, process, cycle.
Explain Non-flow Energy Equation.
Derive expressions for Work done, Internal Energy, Heat Transfer in Isochoric, Isobaric, Isothermal, Adiabatic, Polytropic processes.
Solve problems on the above processes.
Define Air Standard Efficiency.
Explain Carnot Cycle and derive efficiency.
Explain Otto Cycle, Diesel Cycle and Dual Combustion Cycle.
Derive expressions for Air Standard Efficiency of Otto and Diesel cycles.
Solve simple problems on Otto and Diesel cycles.
Classify IC Engines.
Explain construction and working of 2-stroke and 4-stroke Petrol and Diesel engines.
Compare 2-stroke vs 4-stroke, Petrol vs Diesel engines.
Explain Valve Timing Diagrams.
Describe fuel systems in Petrol (Carburetor, MPFI) and Diesel (Fuel Pump, Injector, CRDI).
Explain Cooling and Lubrication systems.
Explain Ignition systems (Battery, Magneto).
Explain Governing of IC engines.

Relations between elastic constants.

Bending equation (M/I = f/y = E/R).
Section Modulus and Flexural Strength.

Failure of thin cylinders.
